reason: Introduced in version v1.8.2, the replacement `CreateTestContextOnly` provides more clarity by emphasizing testing context creation independent of the engine.
Enhancements in usability and flexibility of the framework by introducing new methods, offering better performance and streamlined functionality.
Improved functionality for binding data with better error handling and performance.
AppEngine was deprecated to utilize TrustedPlatform for better header handling. It ensured better integration with cloud platforms like Google App Engine.

CustomRecovery was introduced to replace the older recovery mechanisms, providing more flexible and robust error handling for panic recovery. The improvement allows developers to specify custom recovery behavior.
Improved security by allowing configuration of trusted proxies directly to better handle alternative client IP headers.
Encapsulation of mode configuration to allow more explicit control over the framework's behavior.
To provide a more specific implementation allowing precise testing context setup for individual test cases.
The ShouldBindWith method provides better performance as it avoids storing request body into the context, which is deemed more efficient than storing for reuse.
The `AppEngine` field was deprecated in favor of using `TrustedPlatform` with the value `gin.PlatformGoogleAppEngine` for better integration with Google App Engine.

The 'AppEngine' boolean configuration was deprecated in favor of using `TrustedPlatform` with a value `gin.PlatformGoogleAppEngine`. This change allows better integration with Google App Engine and aligns with modern usage of platform-specific header configuration.
The method CreateTestContext was updated to provide additional functionality through CreateTestContextOnly by enabling context creation with an engine parameter.
